Were you able to restart after that?  Any other bugs in the log that might be
related?  Feel free to attach the whole log if it's not too large.

The log only contained two instances of the exception below.
It was just a test workspace so I deleted after that happened, so I'm not sure 
if I would have been able to recover if I relaunched.

Haven't seen any more instances of this problem and are unable to reproduce it.
Please re-open if you see it again and it is reproducable.

I got this error and I'm pretty sure what when wrong when the error occurred for the first time.  I was running Eclipse.app in a workspace and needed to open a new workspace simultaneously.  I coppied Eclipse.app to Eclipse_copy.app in the same directory and ran it.  I got the error "workspace in use" so I created a new workspace and configured it.

Both Eclipse instances began giving me the error "Could not save master table." and refused to save any project settings (I think may have refused to save project content as well but not sure).

I could probably recreate this if needed.

Work around is to simply close both instances and restart both.
John, what version/build of Eclipse are you using, and what platform?  The build id is found under Help > About.
